kernfrasen: written our death sentence in his own blood
maintenance of what we have earned

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: He became the judge judged in our place.

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer is a criminal facing a terminal verdict.
theologische_implicaties: God's justice must be satisfied through a legal mechanism.
ethische_implicaties: Gratitude for the 'pardon' leads to obedience.
onbedoelde_consequenties: God the Father may be seen as a bloodthirsty prosecutor.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher re-activates the 'death penalty' imagery to contrast with modern 'self-help' culture.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon centers on the 'Helplessness' of the human condition, using Juridical and Spatial metaphors to reinforce the necessity of divine intervention.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the Romans 5 text to bridge the gap between legal status and personal relationship.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the horror of the Cross to break the 'sanitized' aesthetic of modern religious consumerism.
sterktes.voorbeeld: forests untouched by acid rain... versus a scene of unspeakable ugliness.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'death sentence' metaphor is so strong it may obscure the ontological change in the believer.
risicos.voorbeeld: He has written our death sentence in his own blood.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view salvation as purely forensic/paperwork.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The execution site (Golgotha) contrasted with a modern American bookstore.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Strongly connects the 'Cross as weapon' to current events.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeatedly using 'dead', 'helpless', and 'unable to save themselves'.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as Savior of the Dead

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligned with Good Friday solemnity.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by Juridical and Spatial metaphors. It successfully deconstructs the 'Self-Help' schema by replacing it with a 'Dead/Alive' binary. The landscape is stark, appropriately 'ugly' for Good Friday, and avoids sentimentalism.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'blood' to the 'death penalty' more viscerally.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The ink of the warrant is the blood of the Judge.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'Judge' to 'Father' in the Ephesians text.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly state that the Judge's sentence is an act of Fatherly love.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: May imply all human effort is sinful.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Distinguish between 'effort for salvation' and 'effort in sanctification'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To deepen the 'dead/alive' metaphor from Ephesians.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to dismantle modern meritocratic schemas and restore the 'offense' of the Cross.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While aesthetic analysis would praise the 'beauty' of the prose, CMT reveals the 'ugly' source domains required to make the theology function.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning styles, CMT focuses on the cognitive 'mapping' that allows the hearer to conceptualize 'Grace' at all.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that 'Self-Help' is not just a theme but a competing 'Source Domain' (The Self-Made Man) that the preacher must 'crucify' using the 'Dead Man' domain.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: pull themselves up by their own bootstraps
written our death sentence in his own blood
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In Christ, In the world) to define identity.
